title: What are some examples of individual relativism? - Quora

response.answer_text: My difficulty in trying to wrap my head around the question and the responses which have been offered by way of answers, has been to figure out the sense in which the question is asked. Is this a factual or an ethical inquiry? Are we speaking, in other words, about relativism in relation to facts or in relation to values? The distinction is important to draw. Antony Flew (A Dictionary of Philosophy) writes, for instance, that “To be a relativist about fact is to maintain that there is no such thing as objective knowledge … independent of the knower.” William Frankena (Ethics), on the other hand, distinguishes three different forms of ethical relativism – namely, descriptive relativism; meta-ethical relativism; and normative relativism. What each of them denies in different forms is the existence of a universal standard for judging right/wrong or good/bad. How we frame the question - relativism in relation to fact or values – as can be seen from the preceding paragraph, can have different and far-reaching repercussions. Relativism about facts might bring into question everything we do by way of education, for instance. Relativism as to values need not have that consequence. Further, there’s dangerously little we can do to try and win over a person who denies the existence of all objective knowledge. This, I think, is ably demonstrated by one of the answers to this very question, where a picture is painted of a kind of unbridgeable gap between two persons, one of whom asserts that 1+1=2 while the other asserts that 1+1=3. There can’t even be debate in a situation like this. But where we deal with relativism as to values, there can at least be debate about whether, as Frankena argues, “people’s basic and ethical value judgements would still be different even if they were fully enlightened, conceptually clear, shared the same factual beliefs, and were taking the same point of view”. Although I have sought to problematize the question, rather than answer it, I hope that in the three examples of relativism proposed by Frankena, there is some indication of examples of individual relativism.
